question_text: Legal & Judicial Terminology Questions: What is the meaning of stare decisis?
correct_answer: A legal principle that obligates courts to follow historical cases when making a ruling on a similar case. What does amicus curiae mean? - Friend of the court; someone who is not a party to a case who offers information to assist the court in deciding a matter before it. What is the term for a written statement given under oath? - An affidavit is a written statement given under oath and notarized. Professional Standards & Ethics Questions: How long must a court reporter maintain backup audio files? - 3 years from the date of the proceeding. Can a court reporter serve as a notary public in the same proceeding? - No, it creates a conflict of interest. What is the required timeframe for delivering a certified transcript? - Within 30 days of the request unless otherwise specified by court order. Transcription Standards Questions: What is the minimum speed requirement for real-time court reporting? - 225 WPM. How should speaker identification be formatted in Q&A? - The speaker should be identified in all caps followed by a colon. What is the proper format for indicating an exhibit in a transcript? - EXHIBIT [Number/Letter] followed by description in parentheses. Grammar & Vocabulary Questions: What is the correct usage of voir dire in legal context? - It refers to the preliminary examination of a witness or juror to determine their competency. How should Latin legal phrases be formatted in transcripts? - Latin phrases should be italicized or underlined, depending on court preference. What is the proper way to handle interrupted speech in transcripts? - Use two hyphens (--) to indicate interrupted speech mid-sentence.
